result.execSummary:
All charges against Romeo J Perez in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Romeo J Perez is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Romeo J Perez

records.addlTxt: Defendant Romeo J Perez in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State informed court they are unable to proceed. Defense motion to dismiss heard. Court ordered case dismissed and terms of bail/bond terminated and bail if any returned to the person who posted it.

Defendant Romeo J Perez in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Romeo J Perez appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Hearing held via zoom/DAcast.  DPA Hearing scheduled in Branch 37.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Oral No Contact Order with JAP.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 02/25/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Romeo J Perez in court.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 37 for a Pretrial Conference.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 2/23/22 @ 1p
